hymn.title: Thou Breath from still eternity
hymn.category: Fulness of the Spirit—As the Breath

creators.author: Gerhard Tersteegen
Translated by Emma Frances Shuttleworth Bevan

layout.singingstanza: Thou Breath from still e -- ter -- ni -- ty Breathe o'er my spir -- it's bar -- ren land— The pine tree and the myr -- tle tree Shall spring a -- mid the de -- sert sand; And where Thy liv -- ing wa -- ter flows The waste shall blos -- som as the rose.

lyrics.stanza: Thy Spirit, Stream by Thee, the Son, Is opened to us crystal pure, Forth flowing from the heavenly throne To waiting hearts and spirits poor; Athirst and weary do I sink Beside Thy waters, there to drink.

My spirit turns to Thee and clings, All else forsaking, unto Thee; Forgetting all created things, Remembering only "God in me." Thy living Stream, Thy gracious Rain, None wait for these, and wait in vain.
